ca.ualberta.cmput301w15t13.Activities

Class ClaimActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • ca.ualberta.cmput301w15t13.Activities.ClaimActivity

  • public class ClaimActivity
extends Activity
    This activity is used to manage claims for all users. You can view all claims you have permission to see, whether your own claims or submitted claims. From this activity you can also create, edit, and approve claims which are supported by corresponding fragments. Classes it works with: ClaimFagmentNavigator, User, DataManager Overall It acts as the base activity of the App and should be used this way. Sample use: Intent intent = new Intent(this, ClaimActivity.class); startActivity(intent);

      • finishClaim

        public void finishClaim(View v)
                 throws InvalidDateException,
                        InvalidUserPermissionException,
                        EmptyFieldException,
                        InvalidNameException
        Create a new claim object, then return to the viewing fragment. Whenever claim details are being set, if it's a new claim, you cannot finish until everything is filled, so it will only allow you to change fragments when createClaim() returns true.
        Throws:
        InvalidUserPermissionException
        InvalidNameException
        InvalidDateException
        EmptyFieldException
